I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

z: pos n
y: pos n
x: pos n
Hxy: x <> y
Hxz: x <> z
Hyz: y <> z
i: nat
y': pos n
l: list bool
w: Vector.t (list bool) n
v: Vector.t (list bool) n

v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y][(rev l ++ v#>z)/z] -> (i, copy_rev_stack) // (i, v) ->> (9 + i, w)

Inductive bsm_sss (n : nat) : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n ->...-> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x]) | in_bsm_sss_push : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x]) Arguments bsm_sss [n]%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_E [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_0 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_1 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_push [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope

VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n0 : nat, vec ?A (S n0) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n0 : nat) (t : vec ?A n0), P n0 (h ## t)) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v : vec ?A (S n0)), P n0 v where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n z : pos n Hxy : x <> y Hxz : x <> z Hyz : y <> z i : nat y' := y : pos n l : list bool v : vec (list bool) n w : vec (list bool) n |- Type]
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n0 : nat, vec ?A (S n0) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (a ## vec_nil)) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n0 : nat) (v0 : vec ?A (S n0)), P n0 v0 -> P (S n0) (a ## v0)) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v : vec ?A (S n0)), P n0 v where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n z : pos n Hxy : x <> y Hxz : x <> z Hyz : y <> z i : nat y' := y : pos n l : list bool v : vec (list bool) n w : vec (list bool) n |- Type]
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)
vec_eq_dec : forall X : Type, (forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (n : nat) (u v : vec X n), {u = v} + {u <> v}
list_bool_next_total : forall l : list bool, l <> nil -> {n : nat | l = iter list_bool_next (Zero :: nil) n}
subcode = fun (X : Type) (P : code X) (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : forall X : Type, code X -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode {X}%type_scope _ _ /
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
VectorEq.eq_dec : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = One <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : vec A n), {v1 = v2} + {v1 <> v2}
in_bsm_sss_pop_0 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])
in_bsm_sss_push : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x])
rev_eq_app : forall (A : Type) (l l1 l2 : list A), rev l = l1 ++ l2 -> l = rev l2 ++ rev l1
list_One_Zero_inj : forall (a b : nat) (l m : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l = list_repeat One b ++ Zero :: m -> a = b /\ l = m
subcode_right : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m + length l -> (n, r) <sc (m, l ++ r)

``` 
intros.
intros H1 H2 H3.
intros [H4 H5].
intros [H6 [H7 H8]].
unfold copy_rev_stack in H5 |- *.
inversion H5.
subst.
apply step_stacks.
+ exact H6.
+ exact H3.
+ apply subcode_right.
  exact H7.
apply subcode_right in H7.
destruct H7 as [l' [r' [H9 H10]]].
rewrite H9 in H2.
inversion H2.
subst.
apply step_stacks.
+ exact H1.
+ apply step_stacks.
  - exact H8.
  - eapply step_steps_pop.
    * exact H10.
    * econstructor.
      exact H6.
      constructor.
      constructor.
      constructor.
      constructor.
    * exact H3.
  - reflexivity.
+ reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros. intros H1 H2 H3. intros [H4 H5]. intros [H6 [H7 H8]]. unfold copy_rev_stack in H5 |- *. inversion H5. subst. apply step_stacks. + apply H6. + apply H3. + apply subcode_right. apply H7. apply subcode_right in H7. destruct H7 as [l' [r' [H9 H10]]]. rewrite H9 in H2. inversion H2. subst. apply step_stacks. + apply H1. + apply step_stacks. - apply H8. - eapply step_steps_pop. * apply H10. * econstructor. apply H6. constructor. constructor. constructor. constructor. * apply H3. - reflexivity. + reflexivity.
